title: MPOC sees palm oil exports to EU stabilising over long term despite EU deforestation regulation

“I think the demand for palm from the EU will still remain healthy because food manufacturers say it’s the most affordable oil and there’s sustainable supply from producer countries and we have met the sustainability criteria. So there’s no worry that products going to the EU are not certified sustainable,” said MPOC CEO Belvinder Sron.

title: Warning signs for PH and Umno from Sungai Bakap by-election, says Ong Kian Ming
summary: The recent Sungai Bakap state by-election result was not surprising in that it followed the trend of by-election results post 15th general election (GE15), where the incumbent party retained the seat. At the same time, the results were also surprising in that the margin of victory for the incumbent, Perikatan Nasional (PN)/PAS, in this case, was larger than expected. title: A slow trek towards gender parity
summary: While there has been progress, there is still a long way to go for the world to achieve gender parity. According to the Global Gender Gap Report 2024, published by the World Economic Forum (WEF) in June, we have closed 68.5% of the gender gap. However, at the current pace, it will take another 134 years – equivalent to five generations – to achieve full gender parity. Globally, the gap has closed by just 0.1 percentage points since last year.
